tasks.name: Progress
tasks.descriptions: Open source, and web-based, so thought I would make a small React app and put it up on github. And interesting to see how this brain visualiser performs on the internet instead of just locally on my machine. And it's always good to practise!

tasks.name: Previous week
descriptions: Further exploration of Spatialstrates and attempt to improve labelling

tasks.name: Thursday
descriptions: Online meeting with Tirso, Alex, Pete
Alex and Tirso described a range of tools they have used that are worth looking at
Alex described his idea he wanted from an educational tool and that other universities had expressed an interest in what he was doing so far
Tirso talked about various tools and their uuses and features, and sent over some additional .nii files obtained from the MRI scanner at various resolutions.

tasks.name: Friday
descriptions: Experimenting with NiiVue, web-based MRI viewer, to render Tirso's files including a brain activity layer

tasks.name: Monday
descriptions: Investigate other software mentioned by Tirso and Alex
Investigate list of projects using NiiVue

tasks.name: Tuesday
descriptions: start on Niivue codebase in attempt to understand
